inlineContent.text: Ribbons uses the Material Design icon suite. We have selected this group of icons due to its open source availability, deep coverage
and quality of output. Icons are to be used to denote and interaction or to draw attention to an area or component, these two rules are
in place to aid communication and increase accessibility.
Some icons have 2 variations, a solid and an outline. Generally, the usage of these 2 versions are to denote and empty/inactive
vs an active state. The outline variation indicates inactive whilst the solid indicates an active state.
We use 3 sizes of icons - 16px, 24px and 32px. These dimensions are fixed and should not be altered in any way.
These sizes have been selected to best fit a variety of uses, from being nested within a small button to being the main interactive element.

is the graphical component library used by the NOTHS app. Here we have not only components like buttons or labels, but also elements like styles, constants, fonts, and icons.
An enum containing public-facing constants and setup methods.
The reason to use enums across Ribbons is to avoid instantiation and simulate namespaces..
